pr_title: Postgres Writer #1 : move ctl and non-fee transfers

timeline.message:
PostgresWritingRecordParsedItemHandler#1 : move ctl and non-fee transfers

Signed-off-by: Apekshit Sharma <apekshit.sharma@hedera.com>

PostgresWritingRecordParsedItemHandler#1 : move ctl and non-fee transfers

setup generic testing

Signed-off-by: Apekshit Sharma <apekshit.sharma@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText: nit: always best to do a notimplementedexception here and in other places so there's no chance of missing it.
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: sure thing. In 'postgres writer 3', will change to notimplementedexception for any remaining functions.
replies.author: apeksharma

timeline.bodyText:
q: what do you think about making a getter for the prepared statements? Might reduce code repetition and ensure statements used by tests modules are always the correct ones.
Not sure if there's a downside to it
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText:
Originally, i was planning to wait a bit until we figured if this code will use Repository or CopyManager or combination or something else.
However, if you have something particular in mind, lemme know, will do in "Postgres Writer 3".
replies.author: apeksharma
